reviews.review_title: Bon pour une nuit en faisant quelques efforts
reviews.positive_text: L'emplacement n'est pas loin du centre et nous a épargné la foule étouffante de la ville. L'intimité de l'hôtel qui permettait de rentrer discrètement le soir.
reviews.negative_text: La taille de la chambre (bon, c'était prévu). Le lit deux places très étroit. La literie est dure (les gens aiment ou pas). Si on a tendance à bouger la nuit, on réveille d'office l'autre personne. Il n'y a qu'une seule prise dans la chambre. Il y a une multiprise mais pas visible directement. La télévision est petite et ne permet pas de connecter sa tablette afin de regarder un film dessus. Il n'y a pas de parking attenant à l'hôtel mais un payant. Il n'est pas grand du tout et il faut de la chance pour trouver une place alors qu'il est déjà à 150 mètres de l'hôtel). Il faut donc trainer ses bagages (sur des pavés et de multiples rigoles) entre l'endroit où on a pu trouver une place et l'hôtel. Il n'y a pas d'ascenseur non plus. Les escaliers pour monter aux étages (y en a 2) sont, à l'image du reste, étroits. Le petit-déjeuner n'est pas très fourni. Les éléments de base sont, cependant, trouvés : viennoiseries, yaourts, pain, charcuterie et fromage. En guise de fruits : des pommes.

La chambre single est petite mais fonctionnelle, le lit très douillet et confortable. La bouilloire dans la chambre est un plus que j'ai beaucoup apprécié ! Salle de bain propre et fonctionnelle. Accueil sympathique. Je recommande et j'y retournerais sans hésiter.

Les gérants sont serviables et ont même généreusement accepté de laisser ma voiture garée devant l'hôtel, durant tout mon périple. The location was superb, 2/3 minutes straight into the old town, even less to the Château which stands overlooking the hotel. We were fortunate to have a room with a view over the town from the 2nd floor.
The owner is a lovely lady, so helpful and nothing was too much trouble.

I recently stayed at Hotel Du Chateau in Annecy, and I absolutely loved it! The location is perfect – you’re right in the heart of this charming city. The hotel itself has such a wholesome and cute ambience, with heart-shaped carvings on the cupboards that made me smile every time I saw them.

They had an adorable cat and a dog, who made my stay even more memorable! There’s also a lovely seating area that offers a breathtaking view of the entire city. Watching the sunset from there felt truly special.

If you’re planning a trip to Annecy, I can’t recommend Hotel du Chateau enough. It’s a lovely property that feels like a home away from home!

Overall it was an amazing stay, we enjoyed it a lot.

reviews.review_title: Charming Hotel in the Heart of Town with Convenient Parking!
reviews.positive_text: This hotel is ideally located, just a minute away from the town's most stunning attractions, and within walking distance to numerous restaurants, cafes, and shops. One of its standout features is the private parking, which is a rarity in this central area of a medieval town with narrow streets. We stayed in the family room with four beds (though we only used three), and found the beds to be very comfortable, while the room itself was spotless. We enjoyed a beautiful view of the castle right across from the hotel. The hosts were welcoming and kindly provided us with a map of the local attractions. We also opted for breakfast, which included a selection of local cheese, ham, butter, jam, and boiled eggs, as well as a variety of teas and coffee. Although we only stayed for one night on our way to the mountains, this hotel was a wonderful find. Highly recommend!

reviews.review_title: The room was comfortable, clean! There was an electric kettle in the room. I liked the cat and dog that live in the hote
reviews.positive_text: I like the atmosphere of the hotel
Good location, the lady at the desk was lovely when we checked in.
reviews.negative_text: We weren’t allowed to get coffee from downstairs and have it in our room in the morning.

reviews.positive_text: Right next to the Chateau and 2 min walk from the centre. Clean, cute rooms.
The people there are very friendly and helpful,  its great location too , up in the hill .clean and small hotel.
reviews.negative_text: The size of the room are very small rooms as well as the shower and bathroom.

reviews.review_title: Cosy small hotel in city center right in front of castle
reviews.positive_text: Very good hotel for this price category. Staff is very welcoming and helpful. Good view on city from the last floor. Please note that there's no elevator. For me that is not a problem, so I enjoyed 3rd floor without elevator. I can't say nothing about breakfast because I decided to stay without breakfast. I like this small hotel and I would stay again in it if I come to Annecy next time.
Location was perfect for exploring the old town, very clean room with a kettle which was appreciated. It was comfortable and perfect for my stay.
reviews.negative_text: Nothing.

reviews.positive_text:
Very clean property, staff is friendly, comfortable beds, close to everything in the old town
Breakfast for 11€ is a must !
Also very calm and relaxing.

Hill top view right beside the town’s 700 yr old chateau!!  Cozy warm room/bed on a cold fall full moon night!  Located in t old town center close to lake woods train station n other public transportation !
reviews.negative_text: Nothing!

reviews.positive_text: Great location and breakfast, comfortable room with a wonderful view of the castle, mountains and old town! Staff very friendly - all as I wished!
reviews.negative_text: can't think of anything!

reviews.positive_text: The entire hotel is lovely. The owner was really friendly and understanding when I arrived late, and breakfast was great.
Just small, authentically French, clean, comfortable , great location, and quiet.
reviews.negative_text: Rooms are very small but great for a single traveller.

reviews.review_title: The perfect old town Annecy experience
reviews.positive_text: The location was amazing and our views from our 2nd floor room were breathtaking. The rooms are small and simple, but had everything we needed and the bed was exceptionally comfortable. The staff were very friendly and helped us navigate parking (to get to the hotel parking spots you have to call through at the chateau road block) and some train reservations. While the hill to the hotel is steep, the views and charm from the hotel's spot at the top is well worth the effort. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone who doesn't require accessibility accommodations.
reviews.negative_text: Rooms are on the small side, but par for the course in Europe.

reviews.positive_text: Exceptional value for money, beautiful views and within walking distance to the touristy things.

reviews.review_title: A lovely place to stay in Annecy.
reviews.positive_text: Loved this place. It had a pleasant helpful staff and a delicious breakfast.
reviews.negative_text: But of a climb to reach the hotel.

reviews.positive_text: It was beautiful, and in a perfect place. The stuff helpful and warm. Everything perfect.

reviews.review_title: Great location, friendly, helpful staff with comfortable room
reviews.positive_text: Excellent room with a wonderful view. Location was fantastic overlooking the old city. Staff were courteous, friendly and helpful.
reviews.negative_text: The simple breakfast was alright but nothing special.

reviews.review_title: Great place to stay.  We will again.
reviews.positive_text: Absolutely amazing location which meant staying in Annecy was really easy. Kind and helpful staff and excellent breakfast we had a stunning view from our bedroom. Would certainly return.
reviews.negative_text: It was all very compact, but that hardly mattered as we were out all the time.

reviews.review_title: Personal, friendly hotel owners who care about their guest's stay.
reviews.positive_text: The breakfast is excellent and very reasonable. The owners are very hospitable and looked after our bikes as well as our luggage while we were out of town. Very friendly and personal service.

reviews.review_title: Great location for visit to centre and car park access.
reviews.positive_text: Location was great only 2 minute walk downhill to centre. Friendly staff and car park so near. A great find.
Location is the best IF you are lucky with parking.Very nice and responsive staff
reviews.negative_text: The rooms are super extra small. Breakfast..( we chose not to have it ) looked like not much..not worth the money

reviews.review_title: Cozy hotel with friendly staff in a great location.
reviews.positive_text: Cozy room with a very friendly hostess and a beautiful location that is only a few minutes walk from the most famous sites in Annecy.
reviews.negative_text: The only thing that was tricky was parking, which had nothing to do with the hotel. Google maps won't show you how to get there, so we drove around for a bit trying to find a road that would allow cars and not just pedestrians. Finally we figured out that there is a way, but seemingly only in going past the chateau where there are road blockers that go down to let you through. We ended up parking in the nearest parking garage, and though we had to pay a bit for the day, the hotel gave us a night ticket so that was free.
reviews.room_name: Chambre Double avec Salle de Bains et Toilettes Privatives Extérieures

reviews.positive_text: This property was great and comfortable with no frills. The staff were friendly and the location was perfect, sitting at the top of the hill above the busy old town streets. It only takes a minute to get into the heart of the town by foot. The views from here are stunning, as is Annecy itself. We enjoyed our time here and would stay here again!

reviews.review_title: location to the old town excellent although if you are infirm beware of the very steep hill
reviews.positive_text: Good points are the location to the old town, the breakfast was nice
reviews.negative_text:
The room was very small with just enough room to walk around the bed.  The shower room was a joke, very small with a toilet space just large enough to enter and a danger of hitting your head on the hand basin.  the shower has a curtain which raps itself around you once you turn on the water, burr cold plastic curtain. Only two tea bags per day in the room and the kettle leaked.  the window would not lock and during a windy first day blew open several times.
Although the host was polite he lacked any customer skills and was just functional, the hotel lacks atmosphere

reviews.positive_text: Location. Staff. Paco.
Location is superb, a short walk down the hill to the beautiful historic part. Also, we managed to grab a parking space at the hotel, which was great.

Very charming property, modern interior in room.
Location great! 
Breakfast a reasonable price and very good
reviews.negative_text: N/A

reviews.positive_text: The room was clean and the staff were very friendly. The location is excellent, as you can walk down the hill and be close to shops and restaurants in Annecy. The bed was comfortable. Lots of boulangeries around for breakfast.
reviews.negative_text: The room was slightly small and the steps leading up to the room are quite steep - on your way down the stairs, there is a big drop which can be a trip hazard if you aren't paying attention! While we could get a parking space, there are only around 5 spaces in front of the hotel - so it's down to luck as to whether you will get one. The property was also a bit complicated/ difficult to find by car.

reviews.review_title: A walk up to the hotel so should be fit. But the walk up gives you likely the best view in the city. Charming old style
reviews.positive_text: Above the old city with a great view. Convenient to restaurants and cafes
reviews.negative_text: Nothing

reviews.positive_text: We were in Room 15, which had perfect views out onto Annecy, the mountains, the Chateau, and the terrace.  It had everything that we needed, and was clean and comfortable.  Maybe the furniture could do with an update, but it didn’t detract from our stay.
The hotel is very cosy, and the staff is very nice.
reviews.negative_text: It was very hot in the room but there was no air conditioning. Although, there is a ventilator which is almost as good as air conditioning.

reviews.positive_text: I had a single room.. it was tiny. Had all I needed though and everything functioned as it should and didn't want for anything. Clean and tidy amenities. Simple breakfast was adequate, nice to enjoy it outside on the balcony with a view. Away from the main area with a 5 min walk uphill. Not difficult at all
reviews.negative_text: My room faced the castle so had a great view though this also meant people constantly walking past your window and hearing the language of nations up to 7 or so at night. Not a complaint at all, just a heads up

reviews.review_title: Nice, little French Style Hotel in Annacys Old town
reviews.positive_text:
Small, little Hotel in Annency City Centre, beside the Castle. The Old town is starting 1 minute away.
Our room was big enough for 2 people. The beds are, typical French, not too big, but It was OK for us.
The rooms do not have AC, but you can open the window at night. It was very quiet at night, even through its in the centre. 
You can have breakfast outside at the terrace with view over the town and the mountains. The bufee breakfast include croissants, bread, coffee, bio marmalade and more. We just missed some prepared fruits for our muesli. But it only cost 11 Euro, so that's very a fair price.
There is a parking area at the hotel for max 5 cars.
But there are a lot of parking areas just around which are free from 19 to 8 over night. Just ask at the reception.
We would highly recommend this hotel for a short trip to Annecy!
Beautiful view and location.
reviews.room_name: Chambre Double avec Salle de Bains et Toilettes Privatives Extérieures

reviews.review_title: Poor quality hotel with very poor facilities
reviews.positive_text: The location was very good near the old centre of Annecy
reviews.negative_text: The room was very small and sparsely furnished on the ground floor.  There were two windows, one looking at the hotel car park, th e other on the road outside.  There was no zircon and it was very hot outside but if we opened the windows any passer by could clearly see in.  Also at night we could not leave the windows open since it would be easy access for intruders.   The bathroom was simply awful, with a tiny sink and a shower curtain which did not stop water flooding the bathroom floor.  Using the sink invariably caused a flood as well.  The car park was tiny and the car park opposite is limited to 2 hours only, so you have to use an underground car park nearby.  But headroom is only 1.9 metres so roof racks and boxes or tall vehicles cannot access this.  Finally the staff which we met were not particularly helpful or friendly so all in all we really didn't like the place at all.  I forgot to mention - the TV set sits on top of the wardrobe so is impossible to comfortably watch while sitting down.  Mind you the only seats were two hard backed wooden chairs.

reviews.positive_text: Centrally located, lovely place with nice private terrace lookout.

reviews.review_title: Ideal location, quaint, cozy & safe stay!
reviews.positive_text:
The location is fantastic (note that it is in a mainly pedestrian area and on top of a hill so expect a little sweat on the walk up with luggage) but then you are steps away from the castle, all the action (restaurants, shops, cafes of the old town) a few minutes from the lake and about 10-15 min walk to the bus station. 

The bed, pillow & linen were super comfortable. The room was decent size for Europe. Everything clean. The fan was a nice addition given the heat wave (no AC).

Staff was nice & helpful. Was able to leave my luggage free of charge.
reviews.negative_text: Would have been nice to have a little flexibility for  a later check-out, even with a fee.

reviews.review_title: Great stay in lovely room. Large bathroom, comfortable beds, excellent location, the nicest staff
reviews.positive_text: Great location within short walking distance to main streets and restaurants and still very calm. We loved the large terrace with the view of all the old roof tops. The hotel sold lovely wine, beer and soft drinks at very sympathetic prices

reviews.review_title: Wonderful stay.  The hosts were great.

reviews.negative_text: Be ready to climb a hill.

reviews.negative_text: Everything was perfect, but if we have more space it could be absolutely flawless.

reviews.review_title: perfect location, charming stay in Annecy center
reviews.positive_text:
exceptionally perfect location for Annecy, because it is at the top of the hill away from the 'bustle' of the touristy town below, but a 2 minute walk down the hill to get there. so it feels 'far away' in the best, most peaceful way, while actually being really close and super convenient to the town center. 
while we did not have views of the lake, our room looked onto the town and it was so charming.
their terrace patio for picnics and breakfast was very charming and well maintained.
the rooms are simply furnished in a tasteful Savoyard way, and very clean and cheery.
the staff (it seemed family run) was very friendly and helpful. they allowed us to keep some of our perishables in the refrigerator which was very helpful.
reviews.negative_text: no elevators, so be prepared to lug your suitcases up. we left most our stuff in the car and brought up only what we needed.
reviews.room_name: Chambre Double avec Salle de Bains et Toilettes Privatives Extérieures

reviews.review_title: Delightful hotel in Annecy, highly recommended.
reviews.positive_text: Delightful little hotel just next to the chateau in Annecy.  Very friendly and helpful staff (and Paco the dog), comfortable single room looking out at the chateau, quiet.  Breakfast looked good.  Highly recommended place to stay in Annecy
reviews.negative_text: Location was great but it meant always a trudge up the hill to the hotel at the end of the day!

reviews.review_title: Location is great, but property leaves a lot to be desired
reviews.positive_text: The location is what really sells the place. If you want to be in the heart of the city with the old town and castle on your doorstep this hotel is very much for you. The receptionists are also helpful, and the room was very clean.
reviews.negative_text:
Outside of the location, the property doesn't offer any value for money.
The room was tiny and I could barely move around in it, even though I was alone in a double.
The bed was rather uncomfortable with horribly cheap polyblend sheets, which in a room without air-conditioning is an extremely questionable choice.
The breakfast I wouldn't recommend, very limited spread for a buffet breakfast, so unless you like the one specific marmalade they have, or don't like the single form you can get eggs they provide (hardboiled), or you want a toast rather than a baguette, you will be out of luck. You can get a better breakfast for your money in town.
I also looked for a "don't disturb" sign for the room, which it didn't have, so it was annoying to have to yell out the door to the maid not to try and come in when I was getting out of the shower.

reviews.positive_text: Good location, friendly staff
reviews.negative_text: Parking was a little bit tricky

reviews.positive_text: The location, although up the hill, was excellent.  We walked everywhere from the hotel and while close to restaurants and shopping, it was quiet!  The window shutters kept the morning sun from waking us too early.  The view from the room (5) was exceptional and the breakfast buffet was a good value and delicious. Our hosts were helpful and pleasant, too.  The yellow walls brighten up the mood when it rained one day.  We highly recommend staying here.
reviews.negative_text: The bathroom sink was small and a bit of a challenge to wash in.

reviews.positive_text: What's there not to like? From the hotel being at the top of a hill (wear comfy shoes), to the owners, the dog greeting when you arrive - it was all just perfect. Such a beautiful spot.
The location was great! The staff was really helpful and nice. I recommend this hotel!
reviews.negative_text: The water from the shower was going into the bathroom. This should be fixed.

reviews.positive_text: Wonderful breakfast buffet, which you can eat on a beautiful terrace overlooking the city! Everything is beautifully decorated, an the staff were very kind. Next door to a lovely local art gallery in the chateaux (totally worth seeing the alpine paintings)
reviews.negative_text: Room was a bit small (as expected for historic building) - no AC, but a fan was provided. Be aware that there's a steep walk (worth it for the view)

reviews.positive_text: The room was very comfortable and the staff were unobtrusive. II was given a map and instructions on how to check out and then I could come and go as I pleased which was perfect. I got my own shower and had a decent view of Annecy. It's close to the castle and the town centre. If you don't opt for their offer of breakfast there are plenty of alternatives close by. As a solo visitor to Annecy taking in the location and facilities against the price, I believe I got great value for money.

On arrival  we did not know you have to push the button at the lights /bollards to enter the city center by telling them the hotel you are staying in. The owners staff were very accommodating  with any request and let us continue to park after check out. Beds were clean and comfortable and shower pressure was great. I would stay here agin.

We had to take the curtains close all day and night to not be seen by other guests and people in the street. The shower was a nightmare because it has just a curtain, the floor is flat and then it’s impossible to not spare the water everywhere in the bathroom and even in the room, we had to clean with the towels because the water on the floor was too much, even if we paid attention. Additionally, there were ants in the shower and bathroom (bad feeling about the cleanings). Then, I ask for a partial discount (10%) for the situation and they did not provide for it, we paid 115€ and, considering everything, it was a robbery.

reviews.positive_text: The room was clean and comfortable. I've read reviews the rooms are too small, our room was on the top floor and a bit small but certainly not too small. For two of us for two nights it was perfect. We were able to park our car in their carpark, which was unexpected because we had previously been told it might not be possible and we would have to pay to park in a nearby carpark during the day. We got lucky! The hosts were very friendly and the view from our room and the terrace was lovely. The location of the hotel is perfect - right next to the Annecy Chateau and just a 5 min walk down hill to the old town.
reviews.negative_text: A better selection of tea (English Breakfast!) with milk in the rooms would have been perfect, but not a must! There was also some incredibly noisy workmen digging up the path right outside but that wasn't the Hotel's fault and they didn't start work until 8am so not really disruptive if you weren't planning a lie-in!

reviews.positive_text: The location is amazing! Honestly could not have picked better! Walked everywhere. Could go back to the hotel at any point to drop off jackets, shopping, or even change to go to the take! It was a charming B&B feel, with great views and continental breakfast available. Wifi in the room was great, and the fan supplied a life saver.
reviews.negative_text: If you don’t upgrade to the mountain view room, you will not have space for your luggage. We had the standard double room and had to rearrange the furniture to fit our stuff in, and even then there was no room in the bathroom or to walk if you’re living out of two suitcases and two carry ons! The parking available on site is minimal, that’s not ideal! The closest free parking is a 10minutes walk. Quite inconvenient with suitcases! But we managed and were made aware by the property of this before our stay! Seems silly, but the room keys are HUGE, so they take up a lot of space in your handbag.

reviews.positive_text: Hotel is superbly placed to explore Annecy. There is a short climb up the slope from the high street, but this helps to make the hotel nice and quiet. We had the main front room overlooking the city (great view) and was never disturbed at all by the  lively street below. We were lucky enough to get a parking space out front thus saving the car park fees. TIP; buzz the security BEFORE buying a parking ticket and check space availability first. Breakfast will leave you full for the day or until evening at least, plan accordingly.

reviews.positive_text: Annecy'de eski şehire yakın bir bölgede konaklamak istiyorsanız Hotel du Chateau seçilebilecek en iyi lokasyonda. Chateau d'Annecy'nin hemen eteğinde yerleşik, çok hoş bir taş bina. Oteli işletenler son derece misapirperver ve her konuda yardımcı olmaya çalışıyorlar. Otelin hemen arkasındaki geçitten, Escalier du Chateau'nun basamaklarından Old Town'a inebilir arkadlı taş binaların arasından sahile yürüyebilirsiniz. Kahvaltı sade ve güzel. Araç kiralıyarak geldiyseniz yukarı meydanın girişindeki otomatik bariyerlerin inmesi için bariyerlerin önündeki diyafonun düğmesine basıp Hotel du Chateau demeniz yeterli. Otel bahçesi ücretsiz otopark olarak kullanılabiliyor.

reviews.review_title: Schönes, typisch französisches Hotelchen in toller Lage
reviews.positive_text: Lage des Hotels ist hervorragend. Mitten in der Altstadt. Frühstück ist typisch für Frankreich; Auswahl am Buffet ist nicht sehr groß aber durchaus ausreichend mit gutem Orangen-Direktsaft, gutem Kaffee, Croissants und gekochten Eiern, Marmelade, Käse, Schinken und Joghurt. Ausblick aus dem Fenster auf die Altstadt. Es gibt ein Zimmer im obersten Stockwerk, bei dem sich das eigene Bad und Dusche extern befindet, im Gang gegenüberliegend des Zimmers (separater Eingang mit Schlüssel). Ist erstmal gewöhnungsbedürftig, aber ok, da alles sehr sauber. Bei allen anderen Zimmern befindet sich das Bad im Wohnbereich.
reviews.negative_text: Einfahrt zum Hotel zum kostenfreien, allerdings sehr engen Parkbereich, geht nur über den abgesperrten Schlossplatz. Hierzu muss an einer Säule ein Knopf betätigt und auf Französisch um Einlass gebeten werden. Daraufhin werden die Poller eingefahren. Gebührenpflichtiger Parkplatz mit Tiefgarage aber direkt nebenan ("Parking Chateau"). Die Bagettebrötchen beim Frühstück scheinen oft aufgebacken gewesen zu sein.
reviews.room_name: Chambre Double avec Salle de Bains et Toilettes Privatives Extérieures

reviews.positive_text: Meine Gastgeberin war sehr freundlich und hilfsbereit und spricht zudem gut englisch. Mit ein bisschen Glück konnte man einen der Parkplätze am Hotel ergattern und sich die Parkgebühren in der Umgebung ersparen. Die Lage am Schloss (ohne Autoverkehr) ist angenehm ruhig und man ist in kürzester Zeit in der unterhalb gelegen Altstadt. Den Kühlschrank bei der Rezeption durfte ich für eigene Getränke mitbenutzen.

reviews.positive_text:
Top-Lage an der Burg; 5 Minuten zu Fuß bis in die wunderschöne Altstadt (kurzer Abstieg).
Sehr gutes Frühstück mit wenigen dafür aber lokalen und sehr guten Produkten. Von Eiern über Schinken, Käse, Joghurt, süßen Möglichkeiten war wirklch alles da, dazu knuspriges Baguette und Croissants - und der Kaffee schmeckt!
Freundliches und hilfsbereites Personal.
Einige wenige kostenfreie Parkplätze gibt es vor der Tür; sonst weitere kostenpflichtige über den Platz an der Burg in ca. 1 Minute Gehzeit. Zum Be- und Entladen kann trotz Beschrankung vor das Hotel gefahren werden.
Die Terrasse mit Blick über die Altstadt direkt unterhalb der Burg ist im Sommer sicherlich ein wunderschöner Sitzplatz; wir konnten Sie im Winter bei Regen leider nicht nutzen.
Viele Restaurants sind fußläufig zu erreichen. Herrliche Feinkostgeschäfte in der Altstadt.
Die Beschreibungen des Hotels in Booking.com stimmen gut mit der Wirklichkeit überein.
reviews.negative_text: Zimmer und Bad waren zwar klein; das war uns aber vorher bekannt und für uns für eine Nacht absolut OK, von daher kein wirklicher Kritikpunkt. Und in einem alten Haus kann man ja auch nicht mal eben die Räumlichkeiten ändern.

reviews.positive_text:
Hotellet ligger fantastisk med en smuk udsigt over byen og kig til slottet. Meget centralt uden at ligge midt i byen, hvor der er voldsomt mange mennesker midt på sommeren. 
Personalet ( Nicole) var det sødeste menneske og utroligt hjælpsom. Vi havde cykler med og fik lov at stille dem sikkert og aflåst i garagen. 
Morgenmaden var meget tilpas og til os, der skulle cykel en lang tur, var det dejligt, at der også var musli, der fylder lidt mere end croissanter. 
Desuden har hotellet sin egen hyggelige terrasse, hvor man kan tage sin morgenmad med ud eller måltider i øvrigt. Også her smuk udsigt over byen. 
Hotellet i sig selv er hyggeligt og rustikt.

reviews.review_title: Camera uscita da un libro di fiabe, posizione favolosa a due passi dal centro
reviews.positive_text:
L'hotel è davvero molto grazioso e soprattutto pulito, la nostra camera sembrava uscita da un libro di favole ed era più grande di quanto ci aspettassimo, penso che ci abbiano dato un upgrade, quantomeno a me e mio marito, perché la stanza dei nostri amici era decisamente più piccola. 
Il gatto ed il cane dell'hotel sono dolcissimi ed affettuosi, tra l'altro consiglio di andarci anche d'estate perché hanno una terrazza con una vista spettacolare su Annecy. 
Ci hanno permesso di lasciare la macchina anche il giorno del check out, senza sovrapprezzi, e nonostante il parcheggio sia molto piccolo, abbiamo avuto la fortuna di trovarlo. Abbiamo trovato persone gentilissime e che sapevano parlare molto bene in inglese, cosa non sempre scontata in Francia!
Tra l'altro la posizione è fantastica, a due passi dal centro di Annecy

reviews.review_title: Hotel familiar y tranquilo en el pleno corazón del barrio antiguo de Annency.
reviews.positive_text: La situación inmejorable y de fácil acceso en coche. Está situado en la rampa del castillo entre este y la zona de restaurantes, en el mismo corazón del barrio antiguo y a poca distancia del lago. Lo que parecía un inconveniente, el acceso a pie por la rampa, resultó una ventaja al proporcionar un aislamiento perfecto del bullicio de la zona de restauración situada a menos de 50 metros del hotel. Con un trato familiar y un desayuno más  que correcto y de calidad, ofrece un pequeño parking libre de pago (si está lleno tienes descuento en el parking del castillo a precios razonables). Para quién le guste desayunar al aire libre, tiene una terraza con vistas a la ciudad antigua.
reviews.negative_text: No tiene ascensor, lo que para nosotros fue un problema, no obstante nos ofrecieron una habitación en la planta baja a cambio de sacrificar las vistas desde la ventana. No tiene aire acondicionado pero el ventilador que hay en la habitación cumple perfectamente con su cometido. la habitación pequeña pero muy correcta, con todo lo necesario.

reviews.review_title: Un bel soggiorno, piacevole e con tanta bellezza negli occhi: Annecy è davvero un posto delizioso.
reviews.positive_text: L'accoglienza (anche in italiano) e la gentilezza. Mio figlio si è subito affezionato al cane di casa, Paco, veramente "pacioso". La posizione vicina al centro, ma lontano dai rumori. In più la camera da 3 con due finestre ci ha permesso di stare freschi senza dover usare il ventilatore. La pulizia era ottima. E  poi, la chicca, poter fare colazione sulla terrazza.
reviews.negative_text: Forse si potrebbe pensare a un armadio più funzionale e a un frigo in camera. Inoltre, il fatto che non ci sia un ascensore o anche solo un montacarichi limita l'accesso per le persone con disabilità.

reviews.positive_text:
Sehr charmantes Hotel an ausgezeichneter Lage. Reichhaltiges Frühstück, konnte auf der Terrasse mit Überblick über die Altstadt eingenommen werden. Die Zimmer waren sehr geschmackvoll eingerichtet. 
Der Empfang war sehr nett und hilfsbereit. 
Die Stadt Annecy ist sehr schön mit vielen interessanten Gebäuden, vielen Läden und Restaurants, da kann man gut einen Tag verweilen.
reviews.negative_text: Für einen mehrtägigen Aufenthalt wäre das Zimmer zu klein. Es gab auch wenig Möglichkeiten zum Verstauen der Kleider. Die Anfahrt ist etwas kompliziert. Ab besten fährt man gleich ins gedeckte Parkhaus beim Schloss, das ist nicht weit von der Unterkunft.

reviews.positive_text: Posizione centrale, parcheggio disponibile presso l’hotel, ottima colazione, staff gentile e disponibile.

reviews.review_title: Un salto nel tempo in un luogo incantato .
reviews.positive_text: Posizione ottima .Ti affacci e sei già nel castello e a due passi c’è il centro storico e il lago . Dalla mia camera lo vedevo . Camere piccole ma essenziali ,confortevoli e pulite . Abbiamo fatto un’abbondante colazione in una sala carinissima . L’host è una persona garbata e disponibile . Dovessi passare nuovamente da quelle parti , soggiornerei sicuramente in questa struttura .
Ubicación perfecta. Instalaciones y vistas perfectas.

reviews.positive_text: Quarto confortável e decorado com bom gosto. Boa temperatura tendo em conta o frio que estava na rua. Tinha um fervedor de água no quarto que permitia fazer chá. A vista da janela era soberba! Os funcionários foram extremamente simpáticos, permitiram-nos guardar as malas no dia seguinte em que já não estávamos lá alojados. Pequeno almoço simples mas com as coisas essenciais.
reviews.negative_text: Apenas não achei muito confortável a casa de banho ser separada do quarto.

reviews.positive_text: La atención del recepcionista fue muy buena. Nos ayudó en todo lo que le preguntamos.
reviews.negative_text: Cuando llegamos ya no habia sitio en el parking del hotel, pero hay uno publico al lado.

reviews.positive_text: Ubicación excepcional muy cerca del centro histórico. Cama cómoda. Personal servicial y amable. Nos ofrecieron pk gratis en el patio del hotel.  La calle para acceder caminando es muy empinada, para nosotros no era inconveniente y le añadía encanto porque esa calle separaba el oasis del Hotel del bullicio del centro, pero para personas mayores podría ser un inconveniente
reviews.negative_text: Al baño le falta  luz  y olía un poco mal. Sumado a que es muy pequeño resulta algo incómodo
